means: 拿( take的第三人称单数 )

sentence.Network_en: Jane's always annoying her and she takes it out on me sometimes.
sentence.Network_cn: 简老是惹她生气，她有时就拿我出气。

sentence.Network_en: The argument contained herein takes exactly the opposite point of view.
sentence.Network_cn: 本文所持的论点恰恰是站在相反的立场。

sentence.Network_en: The film takes no position on the politics of Northern Ireland.
sentence.Network_cn: 这部电影未在北爱尔兰政治问题上选择站边。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 正是由于这种逻辑取得了(takes)数据和方法调用(calls)的形式而不是静态 HTML，所以客户端才可以随心所欲的使用这种被暴露的商 …
takes guys a few years to get the ink you got ., 一些人要花几年时间搞上去.
cause you know that love takes time ., 因为我知道爱需要花一点时间.
影视专业英语词汇 - 豆丁网 ... T the screening room 试播室 takes 取景镜头 talent reports 劳务报价单.

list.abs: 大学英语四级常用词组 ... take off 拿走；脱下(衣帽等) take on 呈现(面貌)；装出 take oneself off 走开，离去.
一直想夺取take over中国领土的日本占领了东北三省。(强调划线部分)17. 人们了解.
高一英语单词表 - 豆丁网 ... department n 部；局；处；科；部门；系 take over 接收：接管 electricity n 电；电学.
大学英语四级常用词组 ... out of place 不相称；不合适 take place 发生；进行；举行 take the place of 代替.
普吉岛中英泰常用词汇对照表（非常实用） ... 安全通行证 safe-conduct， pass 起飞 take off 落地 touch down.
初中英语短语大全 ... 67．put on 穿上，戴上 68．take off 脱下，摘下 69．good night 晚安.

collins.tran: 与描述动作的名词连用

usage_note.note: Take is used in combination with a wide range of nouns, where the meaning of the combination is mostly given by the noun. Many of these combinations are common idiomatic expressions whose meanings can be found at the appropriate nouns. For example, the expression take care is explained at care.
usage_note.translation: take 能和各种名词搭配使用，其含义主要取决于所搭配的名词。此类搭配是常用的习惯用语，其意义可参见相应的名词。例如，短语 take care 在 care 词条下有解释说明。

entry.tran: （后接名词，用于描述动作或事件）
entry.def: You can use take followed by a noun to talk about an action or event, when it would also be possible to use the verb that is related to that noun. For example, you can say 'she took a shower' instead of 'she showered'.

example.ex: She was too tired to take a shower...
example.tran: 她累得连澡都懒得冲。

example.ex: Betty took a photograph of us...
example.tran: 贝蒂给我们照了张相。

entry.tran: （与一系列名词连用，代替意义更为具体的动词）
entry.def: In ordinary spoken or written English, people use take with a range of nouns instead of using a more specific verb. For example people often say 'he took control' or 'she took a positive attitude' instead of 'he assumed control' or 'she adopted a positive attitude'.

example.ex: The Patriotic Front took power after a three-month civil war...
example.tran: 经过 3 个月内战，爱国阵线夺取了政权。

example.ex: I felt it was important for women to join and take a leading role...
example.tran: 我觉得让女性参与其中，并担当领导角色对于女性而言意义重大。

entry.def: If you take something, you reach out for it and hold it.

example.ex: Here, let me take your coat...
example.tran: 来，我帮你拿大衣。

example.ex: Colette took her by the shoulders and shook her...
example.tran: 科利特抓住她的双肩，摇晃着她。

entry.def: If you take something with you when you go somewhere, you carry it or have it with you.

example.ex: Mark often took his books to Bess's house to study...
example.tran: 马克常常带着书本去贝丝家学习。

example.ex: I'll take these papers home and read them...
example.tran: 我会把这些文件带回家阅读。

entry.def: If a person, vehicle, or path takes someone somewhere, they transport or lead them there.

example.ex: She took me to a Mexican restaurant...
example.tran: 她带我去了一家墨西哥餐厅。

example.ex: The school bus takes them to school and brings them back...
example.tran: 校车接送他们上下学。

entry.def: If something such as a job or interest takes you to a place, it is the reason for you going there.

example.ex: He was a poor student from Madras whose genius took him to Cambridge...
example.tran: 他是个来自马德拉斯的穷学生，凭自身的才华上了剑桥。

example.ex: My work takes me abroad a lot.
example.tran: 由于工作原因，我经常出国。

entry.tran: 请教（问题等）；洽谈(生意等)
entry.def: If you take something such as your problems or your business to someone, you go to that person when you have problems you want to discuss or things you want to buy.

example.ex: You need to take your problems to a trained counsellor...
example.tran: 你需要去找训练有素的咨询顾问请教这些问题。

example.ex: In a true market, the customer can take business elsewhere.
example.tran: 在真正的市场中，顾客可以去别处洽谈业务。

entry.tran: 使…达到(一定水平、程度或状态)
entry.def: If one thing takes another to a particular level, condition, or state, it causes it to reach that level or condition.

example.ex: A combination of talent, hard work and good looks have taken her to the top...
example.tran: 兼具天赋、勤奋和美貌使她得以出人头地。

example.ex: The managing director had given himself a pay rise of 20%, taking his salary to £20,000...
example.tran: 经理给自己加了 20%的薪，使他的薪水达到了 2 万英镑。

entry.def: If you take something from a place, you remove it from there.

example.ex: He took a handkerchief from his pocket and lightly wiped his mouth...
example.tran: 他从口袋里掏出手帕，轻轻擦了擦嘴。

example.ex: Opening a drawer, she took out a letter.
example.tran: 她打开抽屉，取出一封信。

entry.def: If you take something from someone who owns it, you steal it or go away with it without their permission.

example.ex: He has taken my money, and I have no chance of getting it back...
example.tran: 他偷了我的钱，我再也要不回来了。

example.ex: The burglars took just about anything they could carry.
example.tran: 窃贼们盗走了所有拿得动的东西。

entry.tran: (军队、政党)攻占，夺取，赢得，俘虏
entry.def: If an army or political party takes something or someone, they win them from their enemy or opponent.

example.ex: A Serb army unit took the town...
example.tran: 一支塞尔维亚部队攻占了那个镇。

example.ex: Marines went in, taking 15 prisoners...
example.tran: 海军陆战队士兵攻了进去，俘获 15 人。

entry.def: If you take one number or amount from another, you subtract it or deduct it.

example.ex: Take off the price of the house, that's another hundred thousand.
example.tran: 减去房价，又是 10 万。

entry.def: If you cannot take something difficult, painful, or annoying, you cannot tolerate it without becoming upset, ill, or angry.

example.ex: Don't ever ask me to look after those kids again. I just can't take it!...
example.tran: 以后别再叫我去照看那些孩子了，我简直无法忍受！

example.ex: Harry's rudeness to everyone was becoming hard to take.
example.tran: 哈里对谁都粗暴无礼，这渐渐叫人无法忍受。

entry.tran: (尤指在战争中)蒙受，遭受(损害、损失)
entry.def: If you take something such as damage or loss, you suffer it, especially in war or in a battle.

example.ex: They have taken heavy casualties.
example.tran: 他们遭受重大伤亡。

entry.def: If something takes a certain amount of time, that amount of time is needed in order to do it.

example.ex: Since the roads are very bad, the journey took us a long time...
example.tran: 由于路况很糟糕，我们路上花了很长时间。

example.ex: I had heard an appeal could take years...
example.tran: 我听说上诉要花好几年时间。

entry.tran: 需要，要求(某种素质或某物)
entry.def: If something takes a particular quality or thing, that quality or thing is needed in order to do it.

example.ex: At one time, walking across the room took all her strength...
example.tran: 曾经有段时间她得费尽全力才能从房间一头走到另一头。

example.ex: We want to get married and start a family and all. But that takes money...
example.tran: 我们想结婚，生孩子等，可是那得花钱。

entry.def: If you take something that is given or offered to you, you agree to accept it.

example.ex: When I took the job I thought I could change the system, but it's hard...
example.tran: 我接受那份工作时，以为我能改变那种体制，可实际上很难。

example.ex: His sons took his advice.
example.tran: 他的儿子们采纳了他的建议。

entry.def: If you take a feeling such as pleasure, pride, or delight in a particular thing or activity, the thing or activity gives you that feeling.

example.ex: They take great pride in their heritage...
example.tran: 他们为自己的历史传统深感自豪。

example.ex: The government will take comfort from the latest opinion poll.
example.tran: 政府会从最新的民意调查中得到安慰。

entry.def: If a shop, restaurant, theatre, or other business takes a certain amount of money, they get that amount from people buying goods or services.

example.ex: The firm took £100,000 in bookings.
example.tran: 这家公司在票务预订方面的收入达到 10 万英镑。

entry.def: You can use take to refer to the amount of money that a business such as a store or theatre gets from selling its goods or tickets during a particular period.

example.ex: It added another $11.8 million to the take, for a grand total of $43 million.
example.tran: 这就又增加了1,180万美元的收入，总计为 4,300 万美元。

entry.def: If you take a prize or medal, you win it.

example.ex: 'Poison' took first prize at the 1991 Sundance Film Festival...
example.tran: 《毒药》在 1991 年的圣丹斯电影节上获得一等奖。

example.ex: Christie took the gold medal in the 100 metres.
example.tran: 克里斯蒂在 100 米赛中夺得金牌。

entry.tran: 承担，承受，接受(责备、责任或功劳)
entry.def: If you take the blame, responsibility, or credit for something, you agree to accept it.

example.ex: His brother Raoul did it, but Leonel took the blame and kept his mouth shut...
example.tran: 事情是莱昂内尔的弟弟拉乌尔干的，可是莱昂内尔却代他受过，并且对此绝口不提。

example.ex: She's reluctant to take all the credit.
example.tran: 她不愿接受所有荣誉。

entry.def: If you take patients or clients, you accept them as your patients or clients.

example.ex: Some universities would be forced to take more students than they wanted...
example.tran: 有些大学将被迫超计划招生。

example.ex: They were told that Dr Albright wasn't taking any new patients.
example.tran: 他们被告知，奥尔布赖特医生不再接收新病人了。

entry.def: If you take a telephone call, you speak to someone who is telephoning you.

example.ex: Douglas telephoned Catherine at her office. She refused to take his calls.
example.tran: 道格拉斯把电话打进凯瑟琳的办公室，可是她不接。

entry.def: If you take something in a particular way, you react in the way mentioned to a situation or to someone's beliefs or behaviour.

example.ex: Unfortunately, no one took my messages seriously...
example.tran: 遗憾的是，没人把我提供的信息当回事。

example.ex: Her husband had taken the news badly...
example.tran: 她丈夫听到那个消息后伤心透了。

entry.def: You use take when you are discussing or explaining a particular question, in order to introduce an example or to say how the question is being considered.

example.ex: There's confusion and resentment, and it's almost never expressed out in the open. Take this office, for example...
example.tran: 有人迷惘，有人憎恨，可是几乎谁也没有公开表达过。就拿这个办公室的人来说吧。

example.ex: You can attack this problem from many angles, but let's take one thing at a time...
example.tran: 这个问题可以从多个角度解决，不过，还是让我们逐个分析吧。

entry.def: If you take someone's meaning or point, you understand and accept what they are saying.

example.ex: They've turned sensible, if you take my meaning...
example.tran: 他们变得通情达理了，如果你明白我的意思的话。

example.ex: 'I'm not saying it's right, I'm just saying that's what happens.' — 'I take your point.'
example.tran: “我没说这样就对，我只是说实际情况如此。”——“你的意思我懂。”

entry.def: If you take someone for something, you believe wrongly that they are that thing.

example.ex: She had taken him for a journalist...
example.tran: 她把他错当成记者了。

example.ex: Do you take me for an idiot?...
example.tran: 你以为我是白痴吗？

entry.def: If you take something from among a number of things, you choose to have or buy it.

example.ex: 'I'll take the grilled tuna,' Mary Ann told the waiter.
example.tran: “给我来份烤金枪鱼吧，”玛丽·安告诉侍者。

entry.def: If you take a road or route, you choose to travel along it.

example.ex: From Wrexham centre take the Chester Road to the outskirts of town...
example.tran: 从雷克瑟姆市中心出发，沿着切斯特路到达市郊。

example.ex: He had to take a different route home...
example.tran: 他只好从别的路回家。

entry.def: If you take a house or flat, you rent it, usually for only a short time.

example.ex: My wife and I have taken the cottage for a month.
example.tran: 我和妻子租下这套乡间小屋已经一个月了。

entry.def: If you take something such as a newspaper, you buy it or have it delivered to your home on a regular basis.

example.ex: Before the Chronicle I used to take the Guardian.
example.tran: 在订阅《纪事报》以前，我看的是《卫报》。

entry.def: If you take a car, train, bus, or plane, you use it to go from one place to another.

example.ex: It's the other end of the High Street. We'll take the car, shall we?...
example.tran: 它在大街的那头，我们乘车去，好吗？

example.ex: She took the train to New York every weekend...
example.tran: 她每个周末乘火车去纽约。

entry.def: If you take a subject or course at school or university, you choose to study it.

example.ex: Students are allowed to take European history and American history.
example.tran: 学生可以选修欧洲史和美国史。

entry.def: If you take a test or examination, you do it in order to obtain a qualification.

example.ex: She took her driving test in Greenford...
example.tran: 她在格林福特参加了驾照考试。

example.ex: She travelled to India after taking her A levels.
example.tran: 她参加完高等程度考试后去印度旅行了。

entry.def: If you take someone for a subject, you give them lessons in that subject.

example.ex: The teacher who took us for economics was Miss Humphrey.
example.tran: 教我们经济学的是汉弗莱小姐。

entry.def: If someone takes drugs, pills, or other medicines, they take them into their body, for example by swallowing them.

example.ex: She's been taking sleeping pills...
example.tran: 她一直在服用安眠药。

example.ex: I have never taken illegal drugs.
example.tran: 我从未使用过违禁药品。

entry.def: If you take food or drink, you eat or drink it.

example.ex: She made a habit of coming in to take tea with Nanny Crabtree...
example.tran: 她养成了进来和克拉布特里奶奶一起喝茶的习惯。

example.ex: If you don't take milk, cheese or yoghurt, other sources of calcium are important.
example.tran: 你要是不喝鲜奶和酸奶，也不吃乳酪，那么其他的补钙来源就很重要了。

entry.def: If you take a note or a letter, you write down something you want to remember or the words that someone says.

example.ex: She sat expressionless, carefully taking notes...
example.tran: 她坐在那儿面无表情，认真记着笔记。

example.ex: Take a letter, Miss Singleton.
example.tran: 帮我写封信，辛格尔顿小姐。

entry.def: If you take a particular measurement, you use special equipment to find out what something measures.

example.ex: By drilling, geologists can take measurements at various depths...
example.tran: 通过钻探，地质学家可以在不同深度测量。

example.ex: If he feels hotter than normal, take his temperature.
example.tran: 如果他感觉比平时热，量量他的体温。

entry.def: If a place or container takes a particular amount or number, there is enough space for that amount or number.

example.ex: The place could just about take 2,000 people.
example.tran: 那地方只能容纳大约 2,000 人。

entry.tran: 穿(特定尺码的鞋或衣物)
entry.def: If you take a particular size in shoes or clothes, that size fits you.

example.ex: 47 per cent of women in the UK take a size 16 or above.
example.tran: 英国47%的女性穿16码或更大号的。

entry.def: If something such as a drug or a dye takes, it has the effect or result that is intended.

example.ex: If the cortisone doesn't take, I may have to have surgery.
example.tran: 如果可的松无效，我恐怕只能动手术了。

entry.def: A take is a short piece of action which is filmed in one continuous process for a cinema or television film.

example.ex: She couldn't get it right — she never knew the lines and we had to do several takes.
example.tran: 她就是拍不好——她总记不住台词，我们只好拍了好几遍。

entry.def: Someone's take on a particular situation or fact is their attitude to it or their interpretation of it.

example.ex: What's your take on the new government? Do you think it can work?...
example.tran: 你对新政府怎么看？你认为它能行吗？

example.ex: That sort of thing gives you a different take on who you are.
example.tran: 那种事情会让你对自己产生新的认识。

entry.tran: 我自认为;我以为;我猜测
entry.def: You can say 'I take it' to check with someone that what you believe to be the case or what you understand them to mean is in fact the case, or is in fact what they mean.

example.ex: I take it you're a friend of the Kellings, Mr Burr...
example.tran: 伯尔先生，想必您是凯林家的朋友吧？

example.ex: I take it that neither of you reads 'The Times'...
example.tran: 我觉得你们俩都不读《泰晤士报》。

entry.def: You can say 'take it from me' to tell someone that you are absolutely sure that what you are saying is correct, and that they should believe you.

example.ex: Take it from me — this is the greatest achievement by any Formula One driver ever.
example.tran: 信我的没错——这是一级方程式赛车手有史以来所取得的最高成就。

entry.tran: 接不接受随你，要就要不要拉倒(不容讨价还价)
entry.def: If you say to someone 'take it or leave it', you are telling them that they can accept something or not accept it, but that you are not prepared to discuss any other alternatives.

example.ex: A 72-hour week, 12 hours a day, six days a week, take it or leave it.
example.tran: 一星期 6 天，一天 12 小时，总共 72 小时，愿不愿意随你的便。

entry.tran: 忍受，甘受，屈从于(侮辱或攻击)
entry.def: If someone takes an insult or attack lying down, they accept it without protesting.

example.ex: The government is not taking such criticism lying down.
example.tran: 政府决不会甘心忍受这种批评。

entry.tran: 使费尽力气;使精疲力竭
entry.def: If something takes a lot out of you or takes it out of you, it requires a lot of energy or effort and makes you feel very tired and weak afterwards.

example.ex: He looked tired, as if the argument had taken a lot out of him...
example.tran: 他看上去累坏了，似乎这场争论已使他精疲力尽。

example.ex: Having loads of children takes it out of you.
example.tran: 养一大堆孩子让人心力交瘁。

entry.def: If something takes you out of yourself, it makes you feel better and so you forget all your worries and unhappiness.

example.ex: Donating time and energy to others can take you out of yourself.
example.tran: 抽出一些时间和精力帮助别人可以使你忘却烦恼。

entry.tran: 休息 5 分钟/休息 10 分钟
entry.def: If someone tells you to take five or to take ten, they are telling you to have a five or ten minute break from what you are doing.

auth_sentence.content: The sound takes ages to die away in Wormit.
auth_sentence.res_content: The sound takes ages to die away in Wormit.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The sound takes ages to die away in Wormit.

auth_sentence.content: Matthew Sweet takes a new look at Lawrence Durrell.
auth_sentence.res_content: Matthew Sweet takes a new look at Lawrence Durrell.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Matthew Sweet takes a new look at Lawrence Durrell.

auth_sentence.content: She takes some eggs, a few other provisions.
auth_sentence.res_content: She takes some eggs, a few other provisions.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: She takes some eggs, a few other provisions.

Sentence.sentence: It takes efforts to build each book," Maclnnis tells me.
Each interactive textbook is a media-heavy experience built from the ground up, and you can tell that it takes a respectable amount of manpower to put together each one
One of the challenges to build an interactive digital textbook from the ground up is that is takes a great deal of manpower.
It takes time for the human body to get used to it.
Wheat production takes 50% of its energy input for these two items alone
it takes patience for humans to realize their dreams
